Content:: The Catholic Diocese of Saint Gallen (Latin: Di≈ìcesis Sancti Galli) is a Catholic diocese in St. Gallen, Switzerland. The diocese was created in 1847 from the territory of the episcopal see of Chur-St. Gallen. Much of the territory had earlier been part of the Diocese of Konstanz. The St Gallen Cathedral, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is the see of the diocese. This Switzerland-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
